heisig_chinese_memo: The Easter Bunny dropped some nest eggs on my desk and got yolk all over my receipts and stamps.
heisig_constituent: egg, sign of the hare, receipt, stamp, drops
heisig_story: Receipt . . . stamp . . . and a drop in each side to represent a little smear of egg yoke. The third stroke is drawn slightly higher to close the egg up tightly and keep the yoke inside.
koohiiStory1: The Easter Bunny dropped an egg on my desk and got yolk all over my receipts and stamps.
koohiiStory2: The 卯sign of the hare (#2041) hides eggs in his ears for Easter...　RTK2:　ラン　卵巣　らんそう(ovary).
jp_example_words: 卵(たまご): egg(s), spawn, roe, (an expert) in the making
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Two pools, both altered and not quite like a pool you’ve seen before are put together and flipped around – this is an egg. One pool is the egg white, the other pool is the egg yolk. They’re different, but similar.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Separate the two pools from one another. Now the pools look like the kanji. The kanji is one white pool and one yellow pool. Neat, huh?
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You remember Tamagotchi (たまご), right? Well, Tamagotchi is an egg, and the toy looks like an egg, so it’s pretty easy to remember that tamago means egg.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Just think Tamagotchi whenever you see this kanji. Tamagotchi = tamago = egg. Easy!
Ru_Radicals: 丶 (капля), ノ, 卜 (гадание), 卩 (печать)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the two dots (丶) in the hare (卯) are eggs
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The Easter Bunny dropped some nest eggs on my desk and got yolk all over my receipts and stamps.
humanum_full_description_en:
Elaboration: It resembles the shape of a fish egg, the original meaning is the female reproductive cell of an animal. Not found in oracle bones and bronze inscriptions, but found in scripts on bamboo and silk, "Shuowen": "Everything without milk is born in an egg. Pictogram. All eggs belong to the egg."

" Egg " is also used as an animal's egg. The pre-Qin literature uses this meaning, such as "Guoyu Luyushang": "The animal has a long moose, a bird's wing and an egg." Wei Zhao's note: "Weifu is called an egg." Also use this meaning, such as "Mawangdui. The 8th line of "Miscellaneous Remedies": "Take spring bird eggs and put them in mulberry branches (juice)", another example is "Mawangdui. The 42nd line of the Book of Political Strategists in the Warring States Period: "The minister is more expensive than the Qi. Dr. Yan will not believe in the minister. If the minister is low, the minister will be underestimated. If the minister is used, he will hope more than the minister. If the Qi is bad, he will blame the minister. Attack) Qi, Jiang will say: Good works together. If the world is good (attack), you will also abandon your ministers with Qi. The ministers will have heavy eggs."

Because the eggs of most animals are round, " egg " can mean oval, that is, round or elliptical. Such as "The Book of Great Waiting Rites: Xia Xiaozheng": "Na Egg Garlic", Song Dynasty Sima Guang's "Shui Shui Ji Wen" Volume 7: "Building Egg Tower".

" Egg " is also used as a common name for testicles. For example, in Feng Menglong's "Ancient and Modern Tan Generals · Gawking the Tiger" in the Ming Dynasty: "In the past, people feed on tigers, but now people suck tiger eggs?" This usage of " egg " is still retained in the Fujian dialect of today.
388 Characters
humanum_short_description_en: shaped like a fish egg, the original meaning is the female germ cell of an animal.
humanum_full_description:
象魚卵之形，本義為動物的雌性生殖細胞。不見於甲骨、金文，見於簡帛文字，《說文》：「凡物無乳者卵生。象形。凡卵之屬皆从卵。」

　　「卵」亦用作動物的蛋，先秦文獻用此義，如《國語魯語上》：「獸長麋麌，鳥翼鷇卵。」韋昭注：「未孚曰卵。」簡帛文字也用此義，如《馬王堆．雜療方》第8行：「取春鳥卵，卵入桑枝（汁）中」，又如《馬王堆．戰國縱橫家書》第42行：「臣貴於齊。燕大夫將不信臣。臣賤，將輕臣。臣用，將多望於臣。齊有不善，將歸罪於臣。天下不功（攻）齊，將曰：善為齊謀。天下功（攻）齊，將與齊兼棄臣。臣之所處者重卵也。」

　　因多數動物的卵為圓形，故「卵」可表示卵形，即圓形、橢圓型。如《大待禮記·夏小正》：「納卵蒜」，宋代司馬光《涑水紀聞》卷七：「作卵塔」。

　　「卵」亦用作睾丸的俗稱。如明代馮夢龍《古今譚概·囓虎》：「昔人料虎鬚，今人乃吮虎卵乎？」「卵」的此用法仍保留在今天的漢語閩方言中。
388 Characters
humanum_short_description: 象魚卵之形，本義為動物的雌性生殖細胞。

卵(たまご): egg(s), spawn, roe, (an expert) in the making

象魚卵之形，本義為動物的雌性生殖細胞。不見於甲骨、金文，見於簡帛文字，《說文》：「凡物無乳者卵生。象形。凡卵之屬皆从卵。」 「 卵 」亦用作動物的蛋，先秦文獻用此義，如《國語魯語上》：「獸長麋麌，鳥翼鷇卵。」韋昭注：「未孚曰卵。」簡帛文字也用此義，如《馬王堆．雜療方》第8行：「取春鳥卵，卵入桑枝（汁）中」，又如《馬王堆．戰國縱橫家書》第42行：「臣貴於齊。燕大夫將不信臣。臣賤，將輕臣。臣用，將多望於臣。齊有不善，將歸罪於臣。天下不功（攻）齊，將曰：善為齊謀。天下功（攻）齊，將與齊兼棄臣。臣之所處者重卵也。」 因多數動物的卵為圓形，故「 卵 」可表示卵形，即圓形、橢圓型。如《大待禮記·夏小正》：「納卵蒜」，宋代司馬光《涑水紀聞》卷七：「作卵塔」。 「 卵 」亦用作睾丸的俗稱。如明代馮夢龍《古今譚概·囓虎》：「昔人料虎鬚，今人乃吮虎卵乎？」「 卵 」的此用法仍保留在今天的漢語閩方言中。 388 Characters
Elaboration: It resembles the shape of a fish egg, the original meaning is the female reproductive cell of an animal. Not found in oracle bones and bronze inscriptions, but found in scripts on bamboo and silk, "Shuowen": "Everything without milk is born in an egg. Pictogram. All eggs belong to the egg." " Egg" is also used as an animal's egg. The pre-Qin literature uses this meaning, such as "Guoyu Luyushang": "The animal has a long moose, a bird's wing and an egg." Wei Zhao's note: "Weifu is called an egg." Also use this meaning, such as "Mawangdui. The 8th line of "Miscellaneous Remedies": "Take spring bird eggs and put them in mulberry branches (juice)", another example is "Mawangdui. The 42nd line of the Book of Political Strategists in the Warring States Period: "The minister is more expensive than the Qi. Dr. Yan will not believe in the minister. If the minister is low, the minister will be underestimated. If the minister is used, he will hope more than the minister. If the Qi is bad, he will blame the minister. Attack) Qi, Jiang will say: Good works together. If the world is good (attack), you will also abandon your ministers with Qi. The ministers will have heavy eggs." Because the eggs of most animals are round, " egg" can mean oval, that is, round or elliptical. Such as "The Book of Great Waiting Rites: Xia Xiaozheng": "Na Egg Garlic", Song Dynasty Sima Guang's "Shui Shui Ji Wen" Volume 7: "Building Egg Tower". " Egg" is also used as a common name for testicles. For example, in Feng Menglong's "Ancient and Modern Tan Generals · Gawking the Tiger" in the Ming Dynasty: "In the past, people feed on tigers, but now people suck tiger eggs?" 卵字的基本解释

卵
luǎn
动植物的雌性生殖细胞：卵子。卵巢。
特指动物的蛋：卵生。卵石。卵翼（喻养育或庇护）。
昆虫学上特指受精卵，是动物发育的第一阶段。
男子睾丸的俗称。

卵字的汉语字典释义

[①]［luǎn］
［《廣韻》盧管切，上緩，來。］
［《廣韻》郎果切，上果，來。］
(1)蛋。
(2)卵生；孵育。
(3)引申为抚育。
(4)动植物的雌性生殖细胞。参见“卵子”。
(5)昆虫学上特指受精卵，是昆虫发育过程的第一个阶段。如蛾、蝶、蚊、蝇等，有卵、幼虫、蛹、成虫四个阶段。
(6)睾丸。
(7)泛指男性生殖器。
(8)俗用作詈词。
(9)青白色，俗称蛋青。
(10)卵形的或椭圆形的。
[②]［kūn］
［《集韻》公渾切，平魂，見。］
鱼子。参见“卵2醬”。

卵字的英文翻译

◎ 卵
egg, nit, ovum, spawn

卵字的康熙字典解释

【子集下】【卩字部】　卵； 康熙笔画：7； 页码：页159第20
【唐韻】盧管切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】魯管切，?鸞上聲。【說文】凡物無乳者卵生。鳥卵中黃爲隂，外白爲陽。魂魄相待也。【禮·曲禮】士不取麛卵。【前漢·貨殖傳】蝝魚麛卵。【註】師古曰：卵，鳥卵也。又【左傳·哀十六年】子西曰：白公勝如卵，子翼而長之。【註】今撫育人曰卵翼，言如鳥孚卵也。又【蘇軾詩】相逢卵色五湖天。【註】俗攺卵色爲柳色，非。又音鯤。魚子也。【禮·內則】濡魚卵醬實蓼。

卵字的源字形

卵字的起名意思

动物繁殖后代生产的具有硬壳的胚胎。

egg
Basic explanation of words
egg
luǎn
Female reproductive cells of plants and animals: eggs. Ovaries.
Specifically refers to animal eggs: oviparous. pebble. Egg wings (Yu nourish or shelter).
In entomology, it refers specifically to the fertilized egg, which is the first stage of animal development.
Common name for male testicles.
egg
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［luǎn］
["Guangyun" Lu Guanqie, go up slowly, come. ]
["Guangyun" Langguo cuts, puts on the fruit, come. ]
(1) Eggs.
(2) Oviparous; incubation.
(3) Extended to upbringing.
(4) Female reproductive cells of animals and plants. See "egg".
(5) Entomology specifically refers to the fertilized egg, which is the first stage of insect development. Such as moths, butterflies, mosquitoes, flies, etc., there are four stages of eggs, larvae, pupae, and adults.
(6) Testicles.
(7) Refers to male genitalia in general.
(8) Commonly used as slurs.
(9) Blue and white, commonly known as egg blue.
(10) Oval or elliptical.
[②]［kūn］
["Ji Yun" Gong Hun cut, calm soul, see. ]
roe. See "egg 2 sauce".
egg
English translation of words
◎ Egg
egg, nit, ovum, spawn
egg
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Subset 2] [Jie Zi Department] 　蛋; Kangxi strokes: 7; Page number: page 159 to 20
[Tang Yun] Lu Guanqie [Jiyun] [Yunhui] [Zhengyun] Lu Guanqie, Lu Guanqie. [Said the text] All things without milk give birth to eggs. The yellow in the egg is yin, and the outer white is yang. Treat each other with soul and soul. 【Rite·Mixed ritual】Students do not take eggs. [Previous Han · Commodity Reproduction] The eggs of the larva. [Note] Shi Gu said: Eggs, bird eggs. [Zuo Zhuan·Ai 16 years] Zixi said: Bai Gong wins like an egg, with long wings. [Note] Today, raising people is called egg wing, and it is like a bird's egg. Also 【Su Shishi】Meeting the five lakes and sky of egg color. [Note] The color of the common egg is willow, not. And the sound of Kun. Caviar too. 【Li·NeiZe】The fish roe sauce is actually Polygonum.
egg

卵

Значения

Яйцо

Мнемоника

  • Женские яичники. Вертикали в центре — фаллопиевы трубы.

  • Изображение разбитого яйца.
Radicals: 勺  (pool)
Meaning Mnemonic
Two pools, both altered and not quite like a pool you’ve seen before are put together and flipped around – this is an egg. One pool is the egg white, the other pool is the egg yolk. They’re different, but similar.
Separate the two pools from one another. Now the pools look like the kanji. The kanji is one white pool and one yellow pool. Neat, huh?
Reading Mnemonic
You remember Tamagotchi (たまご), right? Well, Tamagotchi is an egg, and the toy looks like an egg, so it’s pretty easy to remember that tamago means egg.
Just think Tamagotchi whenever you see this kanji. Tamagotchi = tamago = egg. Easy!

Examples: 卵 (たまご)
丶 (капля), ノ, 卜 (гадание), 卩 (печать)
